preqs: Students must have passed one of the following before undertaking this unit: AFF2631, BFF2631, AFG2631, BFG2631, AFW2631, BFW2631, AFF3121, AFW3044, BFB2140, BFC2140, BFF2140, BFP2140, BFW2140

rules.ruleString: Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {AFG3121, AFW3046, AFW3121, BFB3121, BFG3121, BFW3121}
Unit was previously coded {AFF3121%, AFG3046%, BFF3121, DEB363, FIN3121, FIN363, GBU3012}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {AFG3121, AFW3046, AFW3121, BFB3121, BFG3121, BFW3121}

Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {AFF2631, AFF3121, AFG2631, AFW2631, AFW3044, BFB2140, BFC2140, BFF2140, BFF2631, BFG2631, BFP2140, BFW2140, BFW2631} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}

Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {AFF2631, AFG2631, AFP2631, AFW2631, AFW3044, BFB2631, BFC2140, BFF2140, BFF2631, BFG2631, BFP2140, BFP2631, BFW2631} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}
Unit was previously coded {AFF3121%, AFG3046%, BFF3121, DEB363, FIN3121, FIN363, GBU3012}

description: On completion of this unit students should be able to demonstrate an understanding of the conceptual foundations of modern portfolio theory, using pricing models and other techniques in the valuation of securities; appreciate the effect of market efficiency on the valuation process; measure portfolio risk and determine performance benchmarks; and be able to take an applied perspective on investment management and analysis.
